item.title: Football Manager 26 Cracks Steam’s All-Time Top 10 Worst Games List
item.content:encoded:
Steam’s user review system can sometimes be overloaded with user bombing and other unfair measures and tactics. However, the writing has been on the wall for Football Manager 26 since its early access beta, and Steam’s all-time worst games list has sadly welcomed it with open arms.

The Football Manager 26 Open Beta was supposed to signal the welcome return of FM. Anticipation quickly turned to agony after it was found that the game was a bug-ridden mess with an unintuitive UI. Problems quickly piled on problems, and the comeback turned into a nightmare. The full release arrived, and as expected, players weren’t happy with the final product.

Developer Sports Interactive said Football Manager 26 Was Helped By Last Year’s Cancellation. FM 25 was infamously delayed and canceled, putting a huge gap in the calendars of Football Manager fans.

Football Manager 26 launched to better-than-expected critical reviews. The FM community wasn’t as kind, and the game’s Steam store page was quickly filled with bad reviews, giving the game a ‘Mostly Negative‘ review reception.

This isn’t the end of the world, as Battlefield 6 REDSEC launched to Mostly Negative reviews. Yet, it’s still being enjoyed by countless users. For Football Manager 26, it went from bad to worse to abysmal very quickly.

FootballGamingZone (through Steam250) found that Football Manager has moved to number seven on the all-time worst games list already. It’s better than Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight and FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction at least, but it’s a sight for sore FM fans’ eyes.

Strangely, there was no major day-one patch for FM 26 either. Even though it’s riddled with performance issues on console, it seems like fixes will be a slow rollout. This will surely risk the ire and patience of those who’ve committed to the game early doors.

This is no doubt a huge disappointment for you who’ve had to wait two years for Football Manager 26. Have you bought FM 26 in any way? More importantly, have you played it? Let us know what you think of it, what needs fixing, and if Sports Interactive has any hope of salvaging this mess through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

item.title: Battlefield 6’s Most Frustrating Challenges Have Been Fixed Or Greatly Reduced
item.content:encoded:
If you’ve played Battlefield 6 online and willingly attempted to complete challenges, you’ve probably come across a fair few with difficult requirements—borderline impossible ones. EA and Battlefield Studios have rectified this with over 90 tweaks.

Battlefield 6 has countless Initiation objectives and other challenges spread across the game. This relates to Classes, specific weapons, game modes, and much more. If you’ve spent a ton of time on one or more challenges to no avail, you might finally be in luck.

Say Goodbye To Annoying Battlefield 6 Challenge Requirements

A Battlefield Comms message confirms that “A total of 90+ adjustments to Challenges and Assignments” have been made—and they are active in-game right now.

Here are a few examples of the affected challenges:

  • “Assault 2: Have Squadmates deploy on your Spawn Beacon. Reduced from 50 deploys to 5.
  • Support 2: Revive teammates as Support. Reduced from 200 revives to 60.
  • Conquest 3: Objective kills in a round of Conquest. Reduced from 30 objective kills in a round to 10.
  • Explosives Expert 2: Get Multi Kills (2+ Kills Onwards) with explosives. Reduced from 20 Multi Kills to 5.”

This list is exhaustive, to be quite honest. Engineers will be greatly pleased to hear that the infamous Engineer Specialist 3 challenge has been reduced. Repairing 6,000 Vehicle Health in one match has been slashed to just 1,000!

Also, many in the community are reporting that once matches are being completed, and challenges where you’ve now met the requirements (because of the reductions) are being unlocked automatically. Now’s the perfect time to start playing BF 6, and we have the best way to buy Battlefield 6 for cheap.

Expect to see a lot of challenges suddenly start being completed and popping up.

Should it have taken this long to make such adjustments? Or is it better late than never, as previous BF games might have done? Share your thoughts on Battlefield 6 challenges and the game as a whole via the Insider Gaming Discover Server.

item.title: Does Where Winds Meet Have Multiplayer Co-Op & Multiplayer Explained
item.content:encoded:
Where Winds Meet is right around the corner, offering hours of entertainment, and we’ve got all the details on multiplayer and co-op in the title.

Where Winds Meet has already achieved huge success in China, where it initially launched in December 2024, and is poised to make a global debut on November 14, launching on PC and as a console exclusive on PlayStation 5.

Multiplayer is a huge component of modern gaming, though it isn’t always present, and we’ve got all the details on the multiplayer situation in Where Winds Meet.

Does Where Winds Meet Have Online Multiplayer?

Yes, Where Winds Meet offers various multiplayer modes, including PvP and campaign dungeons.

The matchmaking social hub can host up to 30 players simultaneously, while campaign dungeons range in degrees of difficulty and support either five or 10 players.

There are also various multiplayer-only challenges spread across the map, though these are entirely optional and can be avoided.

In fact, all multiplayer in Where Winds Meet is entirely optional, and if you’d prefer a solely single-player adventure, there will still be over 100 hours of content to enjoy as a solo player.

Does Where Winds Meet Have Co-Op?

Yes, Where Winds Meet supports online co-op for up to four players, while campaign dungeons raise that figure to either five or 10 players working together, depending on the difficulty of the dungeon.

Co-op mode allows players to explore the world together, searching for historic traces, defeating bosses, solving puzzles, and participating in events.

All players in the session will receive rewards for first-time completion of side story or campaign tasks, while players within a certain range will receive rewards for solving puzzles.

There are some restrictions, however, as only certain quest items owned by the host are visible and usable, but all items will be restored to normal when you return to your own world.

Like all multiplayer in Where Winds Meet, co-op is optional and isn’t required, with the game offering plenty to solo players who don’t want to join up with others to tackle the world—though it can help to open a co-op lobby if you’re struggling with a specific boss.

item.title: Canceled Dante’s Inferno 2 Details & Screenshots Have Finally Been Revealed Years Later
item.content:encoded:
Dante’s Inferno 2 was expected to be the successor to EA’s new hack-and-slash franchise at the time. For whatever reason, it never happened, and it’s been on the shelf for the last 15 years. While some bits and pieces have come out over the years, we’ve now gotten a proper look at the canceled ‘Dante’s Inferno 2: Purgatorio’ title.

Dante’s Inferno was touted as the next big hack-and-slash game to rival the likes of God of War and Devil May Cry—it also looked and played a lot like the former. We used it in our best games to play like Ninja Gaiden 4 list, and despite the God of War comparisons, Dante’s Inferno reviewed decently, sold respectably, before a potential Dante’s Inferno 2 disappeared off the face of the Earth…until now.

Dante’s Inferno 2 Would Have Been The Second Game In A Trilogy

The original Dante’s Inferno saw Dante—a Templar Knight—battle through horrible monsters and bosses through the Nine Circles of Hell. Its combat, nifty camera angles, puzzles, and bosses were reminiscent of God of War.

A full report from IGN has dug deep into history and uncovered many lost tidbits about Dante’s Inferno 2. It includes screenshots, concept drawings, and how the game’s story would unfold—as well as a third game!

‘Dante’s Inferno 2: Purgatorio‘ was the official title for the second game. IGN says it had: “A 240-page script penned by Assassin’s Creed 2 co-writer Joshua Rubin that outlines every stage, boss battle, and plot point planned for Dante’s Inferno 2: Purgatorio.”

The sequel would also have shifted away from the God of War influences and looked to forge its own identity.

IGN’s report outlines and details every single level throughout the game, with the Seven Sins being a huge aspect, and how Dante would climb Mount Purgatory. Furthermore: “Visceral planned for Dante’s Inferno 2 to include co-op and multiplayer modes.”

Another document uncovered finds that the sequel’s conclusion would set up the events of “Dante’s Inferno 3: Paradiso.” You can check out more details and screenshots in IGN‘s full findings.

item.title: Where Winds Meet Preload Guide & File Size Explained
item.content:encoded:
Where Winds Meet is one of the biggest and most anticipated releases on the horizon in 2025, and we’ve got all the details on when you can preload the game to jump into the action.

After achieving vast success in China, Where Winds Meet releases globally on November 14 on PC and PlayStation 5 as a console exclusive title, with millions of players already pre-registering for the game.

If you can’t contain your excitement and want to preload Where Winds Meet in advance so you can dive straight into the game on launch, we’ve got all the details.

When Can You Preload Where Winds Meet?

Preloads for Where Winds Meet will be available from November 12 at 2 PM PT, NetEase has confirmed to Insider Gaming.

This gives you plenty of time to download Where Winds Meet in advance for launch, and preloading is recommended due to the large file size and the fact that servers will likely be stretched by an influx of players the moment the game goes live.

The table below shows when preloads for Where Winds Meet will be available in major time zones across the world.

Where Winds Meet File Size Explained

Exact file sizes for Where Winds Meet depend on your platform, with PC users having several options to download, while PlayStation 5 has a single version.

Users on PC have three different versions to choose from, with the Lite version clocking in at 68 GB, the Standard version requiring around 100 GB of space, and the Ultimate version requiring 120 GB—though the Ultimate version of the game may not be available immediately.

For PlayStation 5 players, the download size is around 108 GB total, and there are no other options for the download.

Bear in mind that these sizes are subject to change and could increase with day-one patches.

How to Preload Where Winds Meet

If you want to preload Where Winds Meet, you can do so by visiting your platform store once the preload has been made available.

On Steam, simply search for ‘Where Winds Meet’ in the store and find the preload option, which is available without needing to spend any additional cash due to the title’s free-to-play status.

The approach on PlayStation 5 is similar, requiring you to search for ‘Where Winds Meet’ in the PS Store, though make sure you click the right version, as there is a paid-for pre-order edition that provides additional rewards. If you just want the free-to-play version, make sure you select it.

item.title: All Where Winds Meet Pre-Registration Rewards, Listed
item.content:encoded:
Where Winds Meet is whistling onto the scene, and there are a bunch of pre-registration rewards available to earn to begin your journey. We’ve got all the details on the rewards and how they are claimed within the title.

Releasing November 14, Where Winds Meet has achieved vast success in China, where it initially released on PC in December 2024, and is now launching globally on PC and as a PlayStation 5 console exclusive.

Pre-registration rewards in Where Winds Meet are available to players on both platforms, and we’ve got the full breakdown on everything there is to claim.

All Where Winds Meet Pre-Registration Rewards

Pre-registration rewards for Where Winds Meet are unlocked as a community goal, with each stage of rewards requiring a total number of pre-registrations to be secured.

At the time of writing, all but one of the pre-registration rewards have been unlocked, with four rewards available for players. However, the final reward, the Swaying Lotus Skin, is yet to be unlocked and requires a total of 10 million pre-registrations to be distributed to players.

The rewards available for pre-registration are cosmetic or currency-related, though the first two have not been detailed fully and are merely indicated as ‘gifts’ for now.

All the pre-registration rewards available for Where Winds Meet are detailed in the table below, along with their community goal requirements.

How to Claim Pre-Registration Rewards in Where Winds Meet

All redeemable rewards in Where Winds Meet are not automatically added to your inventory and must be claimed manually using the in-game Letter system.

The Letters feature is accessible from the main menu within the game as an option to select on the right-hand side of the same screen where you can change your gear and skills, view quests, and change appearance.

It’s worth keeping an eye on your Letters in-game, too, as there will be a bunch of rewards to claim throughout your progression in the game.

item.title: Does Where Winds Meet Have Crossplay? Cross-Platform Status, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Big releases continue to come thick and fast heading into the latter stages of the year, and Where Winds Meet stands as one of the biggest upcoming titles. This guide has all the details on crossplay and cross-progression.

Releasing November 14 for PlayStation 5 and PC, Where Winds Meet is ready to make waves globally after releasing in China exclusively in December 2024, and there’s plenty of anticipation for the title.

If you’re wondering what platform to grab Where Winds Meet on and whether you will be limited on the crossplay front, we’ve got everything you need to know.

Does Where Winds Meet Have Crossplay?

Yes, Where Winds Meet supports crossplay between PlayStation 5 and PC, allowing you to play alongside players on both platforms with no restrictions.

Crossplay is a built-in feature to Where Winds Meet, with no additional settings required to be activated, and you will immediately be able to jump into an adventure with players across both platforms.

The feature will be available across all online areas of Where Winds Meet, including co-op lobbies, campaign dungeons, and the matchmaking social hub.

That means that, whatever your playstyle and approach for Where Winds Meet, you can enjoy the game with friends and other players across all platforms, with no restrictions placed.

Does Where Winds Meet Have Cross-Progression?

Yes, Where Winds Meet supports cross-progression on PlayStation 5 and PC, with any game process able to be shared across both devices.

To access this, players must sign into the same account on each platform, as progress is saved on the account. With this feature, you can freely switch between playing on PC and PS5 without needing to start again.

With shared progress, you can continue your adventure on the fly on PlayStation 5 and PC, switching up to your heart’s content, and you won’t need to worry about which platform to start the game on, as you can switch if you feel you’d prefer to be playing on desktop or on console.

Make sure to keep your account information handy to access the cross-progression feature, as you’ll need to sign in every time on the same account to take advantage.
